posts.author: KidMiracleman
posts.content:
I was wondering if there is a way to make a Pale Master tank.  20 levels of either Wizard or sorcerer then 10 levels of PM and then 10 levels of either DD or barbarian 

David

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Just guessing here but probably a mage20/PM19/tumble class 1, high-CON EDR gnome would achieve the highest AC.  Take EMA and Epic Warding in epic levels.  EW combined with EDR 3 and Deathless Mastery should be near impossible to touch for 4 turns/day.  The loss of PM 20 AC will be more than compensated by the +4 Tumble AC over xclassed.  It's actually pretty easy to build a toon thats only duty is to stand there and take punishment even with the Mage20 prereq.  If you decide to pump a tertiary ability, use WIS and a monk dump.

I don't see DwD or barb adding anything at all useful.  DwD perhaps DefAwareness 2 only if you invest heavily into DEX which IMO would be a bad idea considering that you will be wanting to at least cast spells and need to boost CON way up.

Wiz would be mage of choice for bonus feats and skill dumps.

There are plenty of ways to make a PM tank.  What sort of world are you playing on?  What's the magic level like?  What sort of parties will you play in?  You indicate Wiz or Sorc, and I don't have a lot of experience with wiz/sorc-based PMs, but you might consider melee-based tank as well, particularly for more HP.  I've had good success with melee-based PMs

One good one is Valerfor's Bard/RDD/PM (http://nwnecbguild.forumer.com/topic/23 ... 8bZL_krKUk).  He uses RDD for more hp (both hit dice and con increase) and has a reasonable AB (43) for having 20 levels of PM.

Many people assume you need to be wiz/sorc based (and some PWs like Kharlindale require 20 levels of wiz/sorc before taking PM), I was pointing out that there are melee PM tanks that work really well and showing a few successful builds that I know work AND can function well while soloing if need be. posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
@Dante: Yeah, I figured it was either a class restriction or perhaps qualifiying for some uber piece of gear with the mage20 part.  I, like you, am only guessing without full disclosure.  BTW, I do like your fighter/PM.  It looks like an interesting build to solo or party.  Most PMs do not melee very well after their touch attacks have been exhausted.

@Kid: I think you are on the right track but to tank you are going to need MANY more PM levels. 

Sorc is not a good fit for PM, generally, because you won't get enough of a spell repertoire and miss out on all the bonuses that a PM caster sorely needs (actually, the only combo I would consider would be src/PM/BG and that screws your tumble AC). 

Wizards can learn all the spells they want from scrolls so it's always a good idea to determine what scrolls are readily available on the server before beginning to select your per-level spells and save the leveling choices for spells that don't appear in scroll form.  It's also a good idea to wedge Craft Wand in there (assuming there are either bone wands or large bone drops available).  You'll be able to cast all those wand spells without failure should you decide to use an armor/shield switch without the still spell series and they are extremely useful to help conserve slots for long solo crawls.  You'll still suffer an AoO unless you cast from under a shroud of Darkness (True Seers, Ultravisioneers still get an AoO attempt under Darkness, though).

Sry. Haven't tried to calculate the subrace deal yet.  Perhaps after you get closer to an official PM tank, we can begin considering variants.

KidMiracleman wrote:
I am now thinking maybe a Sorcerer20/PM10/CoT10.  I was thinking Sorcerer because it uses Cha and so does CoT.
I was thinking maybe Paladin instead of CoT because with Paladin I can get fear immunity and heavy armour proficiency

​Thoughts?

David



 
CoT only uses CHA for Divine Wrath's duration, a once per day feat and a COT 10 DivWrath is nothing to write home about..  Hardly worth designing a toon around.

PM non-good and Pally LG won't mix which is why I stated the only sorc-focused PM I would consider is Src/PM/BG.  But you'd need to muck up your ability spread with STR 13 and blow 2 feats (PA/Cleave) to get BG.  Don't think so.  That would be more a spellsword build than a tank.  You'd need Autostill 3 to cast all spells in heavy armor and only wizard provides enough bonus feats to develop your metamagic, penetration and, if enough room, at least spell:focus in necromancy going towards autostill.

Your request asked for a PM tank.  PM is used to reach uber AC.  That's how it tanks. Crit immunity is an added bonus.  Without a tumble class you are throwing away 4 AC.  Besides, only epic PMs reach the AC levels needed for a caster to tank.  Your HP pool is going to be woeful unless you pump CON way up and there are only so many ways to split the ability bumps before it all becomes diluted.

I really can't follow what you are trying achieve by throwing CoT into the mix.  Are you trying to change a caster into a spellsword somehow?  If so, you've chosen the wrong mix because you'll be limited to wiz weapons like daggers, clubs, etc.

CC/ICC is practically worthless with maxed Concentration and uber CON which is pretty much essential with 4 HD classes.  The free spell penetration is handy and this looks like it would get small stature benefits (at least the female version, anyway) but otherwise I don't see any outstanding advantages over, say, gnome or halfling.

So, how would this work on your server?  You'd make a medium race human and then it would magically morph into a small race Mindflayer when you relogged or is that only gender-based?

I kinda figured the mage 20 was a prereq so thanks for clearing that up for all concerned.  At least you can use all the other non-compatible builds thrown out as metrics to compare against.

The monk build's major benefits, monk AC, WIS AC, speed... only works without armor, so if you are set on using armor/shield, you will need autostill assuming you want to cast arcane spells (and why wouldn't you?).  It will force you to use either Tenser or Iron Golem to melee, but that's not necessarily a bad thing.  Lemme see what I can come up with integrating all those still spell feats** and perhaps others can make suggestions in the meantime.  You won't need combat feats as a dedicated caster so CoT or fighter really won't buy you much in that case.  As the other builds have shown is that a spellsword PM needs lots of help to accrue an AB that will become a factor.  What's needed for a caster to tank is a large HP pool, as much DR as possible and of course the highest AC to prevent getting hit much. 

BTW, on this server you plan to play, can you erect all three recipro shields (death, acid, fire)?  If you get KD'd, you'll still be doing lots of damage until the round ends and you can begin casting offensively again.

Your UMD should be high enough by the build's end to equip any gear regardless of class or alignment restrictions.  Max it out at 42 (40) if necessary.

A few things I should mention about playing a melee mage if you don't have experience yet... all the polymorphs like Tenser, Iron Golem etc. can use all the PM summoning and touch attacks while in that form and the paralyze/death DC is around 20-25ish. Specifically, Tenser also gets the PM crit immunity.  The Iron Golem doesn't need it.  The extended Tenser will last about 4 hrs as will the extended haste.  If you can't do enough damage with Tenser's +3 weapon, shift to an Iron Golem pre-buffed with Premonition which will pierce +5 DR until receiving 600 damage or Epic Warding which will pierce +20 DR until receiving 1000 damage.  The piercing effect only works for creature weapons, though, not with Tenser's sword, unfortunately.  And both those epic spell buffs (EMA, Epic Warding) can be cast while polymorphed.

Maybe UMD has been disabled on your server.  Easy enough to check.  Take the gear to a few merchants to get an idea of the value (there is typically a mark-up of some amount so it would be an estimate).  For a net UMD score of 40, a class emulation is good for 1.8M gold.  So if the resale value is lower and your toon can't equip it, UMD has been disabled... a somewhat important fact to disclose about the server.

You can plug in any class you like.  BG requires STR 13, Power attack and Cleave so the build I suggested won't help you include that class and will nerf much of your casting prowess and 4 AC.

posts.content: How about Wizard 21/PM 10/Cleric 9?

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
The mindflayer may help a bit since there is enough of an INT bonus that you can bump CON more often and perhaps still achieve the EDR prereq.  The INT modifier is important to maintain good universal spell DCs without investing separately into school focus.  The free penetration feats will free up other potential. However, the subraces that prevent polymorphing will screw your melee ability if you go up against raks, demilichs and other spell immunes.  I wouldn't make a female, though, else your toon won't be able to hold a tower shield (assuming the male is a medium race).  Favored wizard means an early cleric level won't impact XP penalty.  A plus.

If your only reason to take cleric is for the amor you mentioned and there is no minimum class requirement, Wiz 21/PM 18/Clc 1 has better tank potential and better touch attack.  You'll correct me if I am arong, but I suspect the vampire mage summon is worth striving for (never summoned one but it looks impressive).  Wiz 20/PM 19/Clc 1 even results in another PM bonus feat, which certainly wouldn't hurt.  Those extra PM levels will recover all the AC lost (4 AC) without a tumble class tertiary.  Clc 9 buffs are so easily dispelled and durations so short that you really don't want to dilute your INT or CON with a WIS 15 requirement for casting level 5 cleric spells when they will be ineffectual in a Level 40 environment.  At least cleric doesn't have any skill or feat prereqs and no alignment restriction so that's a step in the right direction IMO.  Taking one cleric level early enough won't affect the build's strengths, enable hvy armor/shield and just push back the mage 20 milestone by one level... no biggie.
